 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 2.5 - INPUT MODALITIES
TARGET SIZE(LEVEL AAA)
On accessible websites...

The size of the target for pointer inputs is at least 44 by 44 CSS pixels except
when:

Equivalent The target is available through an equivalent link or control on the
same page that is at least 44 by 44 CSS pixels;Inline The target is in a
sentence or block of text;User Agent Control The size of the target is
determined by the user agent and is not modified by the author;Essential A
particular presentation of the target is essential to the information being
conveyed. These websites...

Make it easier for users to operate functionality through various inputs beyond
keyboard.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
Example 3: Anchor Link
The target is an in-page link and the target is less than 44 by 44 CSS pixels.
Users can scroll the screen using browser functions so target size does not need
to be met. I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/target-size.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
